p: Global atmospheric warming leads to climate change that results in a cascade of events and increases environmental exposures and amplifies health and social vulnerabilities that influence human mortality [ 1, 2]. Over the past 50 years, climate change has caused global temperatures to increase and severe weather events to become more common [ 3, 4]. Each year, extreme heat kills more people in the United States (U.S.) than storms, floods, and lightning combined, making it one of the most lethal natural events [ 5, 6].
